intro: Enterosora fawcettii, commonly known as the Fawcett's enterosora, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in shaded, moist forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
